titleInfo.title: Essay submitted by Rubye L. Fowler, United States Marine Corps Women's Reserve

subject.topic: United States-- Armed Forces-- Women's reserves

mods.abstract: As part of a Tennessee Historical Society project documenting and interpreting "Home Front Tennessee: The World War II Experience", Mrs. Rubye L. Fowler of Cookeville submitted this six page personal essay in response to a series of questions intended to explore an individual's experience here in Tennessee during World War II. Ms. Fowler served in the United States Marine Corps Women's Reserve. Titled "Uncle Sam Has a Heart", Mrs. Fowler constructs this essay in the form of a conversation with her granddaughter telling her stories about applying for Officers' Training in the Marine Corps Women's Reserves and her assignment at the Mail and File Division at the Marine Corps Headquarters in the Navy Annex in Washington, D.C.
mods.accessCondition: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. titleInfo.title: "Home Front", World War II Oral History Project, 1991-1993

relatedItem.abstract: We're here to help you bring Tennessee history alive in the classroom! The Tennessee State Library and Archives (TSLA) is a great resource for educators and students seeking primary sources for use in the classroom. With extensive holdings in Tennessee, Southern, and regional history, TSLA is also the official repository for the permanent records of the State of Tennessee...
